    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
It was a highly anticipated derby between Real Madrid and Atlético Madrid, and the Santiago Bernabéu was buzzing with excitement as the fierce rivals prepared to do battle. The game started with Real Madrid kicking off, and within the opening seconds, the ball was already out of play. This was an early indicator of the physical and cautious nature that both teams would employ throughout the contest.

At just 1:31 into the game, Real Madrid made their first offensive move with a shot that went off target. This was quickly followed by another instance of the ball going out of play, setting the tone for a half where play was frequently interrupted. Atlético Madrid responded defensively with a clearance at 2:04, demonstrating their resolve to keep their rivals at bay.

The early minutes were spent mostly toggling between throw-ins and brief possessions, with minor fouls breaking up the flow of the game. Both teams traded territorial advantages, with neither managing to carve out a clear goal-scoring opportunity. Real Madrid, however, seemed the more aggressive side, especially when looking at their attempts on goal, albeit mostly off target.

Moments of set pieces were aplenty, beginning with throw-ins and indirect free kicks resulting from fouls, reflecting the stop-start nature defined by tactical fouling. At 10:48, a promising indirect free-kick taken by Real Madrid led to a couple of shots off target, showing glimpses of their attacking potential. Despite these efforts, shots on goal either missed narrowly or were effectively neutralized by Atlético’s resolute defense.

Atlético mounted their first attacking threat at the 14:54 mark with a shot that went off target, a reminder to the Real defense that they were capable of countering effectively. Through the first quarter-hour, the game remained tightly contested. Real Madrid’s defense was sturdy, with prompt clearances whenever Atlético managed to push forward, evident as play moved toward the 20-minute mark.

One of the notable defensive plays was a clearance by Real Madrid at 15:12 which halted a budding attack. Another key moment was the corner won by Atlético at the 20:29 mark, but Real Madrid’s defense was adept at dissipating the threat. The match saw numerous throw-ins by both sides, reflecting a pattern where possession couldn’t be retained for long stretches.

As the first half progressed, more fouls were committed, particularly by Atlético. In the 26th minute, a free kick was awarded to Real Madrid due to a foul which, although it resulted in a shot, went off target. Another sequence of corners for Real Madrid around the half-hour mark created flutters in the Atlético defense but still did not materialize into a goal. Around 31:34, Real Madrid managed to direct a free-kick on target, showcasing their precision from set-pieces, although the shot was saved. 

The deadlock was not broken in the first half, despite Real Madrid having several opportunities. By the half-time whistle, both teams headed into their dressing rooms with plenty to ponder, especially regarding converting those sporadic chances into the game’s inaugural goal.

As the second half kicked off, Real Madrid made a substitution meant to inject fresh energy into their game, showing their intent right from the restart. Atlético Madrid also looked to change the trajectory of the match with their substitution. Within seconds, however, the ball was again out of play, resuming the pattern from the first half.

Real Madrid continued probing with a shot on target at the 3:04 mark, a more positive start compared to their earlier attempts. Atlético remained resilient in defense, with their clearances reflecting their intent to repel Madrid’s attacks. Real Madrid kept the pressure on with multiple instances of corner kicks, hoping to break the deadlock, but it wasn’t until 7:43 that a sustained spell of possession could be observed by either side.

Key defensive moments in this period included a clearance at 03:37 by Atlético and several tactical fouls that broke up Madrid’s rhythm. Both teams continued to trade throw-ins, struggling to maintain fluid play.

Real Madrid showed defensive prowess as well, nullifying Atlético’s promising moves. The turning point came shortly after halftime when Atlético began incurring a series of fouls, leading to yellow cards that underscored the mounting tension on the field. Around the 30th minute of the second half, a notable yellow card was converted to a red, reducing Atlético to ten men and significantly influencing the dynamics of the match.

From that point on, Real Madrid began to assert more control. With their numerical advantage, they increased their attacking endeavors. By the 34:27 mark, they were consistently testing Atlético's undermanned defense with multiple shots, both on and off target. Notably, Real Madrid’s pressing led to a series of corners which again showcased their set-piece strengths, keeping the pressure squarely on Atlético.

The heightened aggression paid off when, at 42:11, Real Madrid finally broke through. A well-executed shot on target found the back of the net, sparking jubilation among the home crowd and shifting the momentum firmly in their favor. The goal was a culmination of relentless pressure and tactical adjustments, exploiting their man advantage perfectly.

Atlético attempted to regroup quickly, with a kick-off followed by a shot off target almost immediately as play resumed. Yet, their efforts were in vain as they couldn't reclaim control against a well-organized Real Madrid setup.

The closing moments saw a flurry of substitutions by Real Madrid, aimed at preserving their lead and ensuring fresh legs in the final bouts of play. Despite Atlético's attempts to breach Madrid’s defense, the dismissal earlier rendered their efforts less threatening.

A few fouls committed by Real Madrid later on led to some minor tensions, but nothing that jeopardized their lead. Defensive clearances and tactical fouls characterized the final minutes, with the game's tempo reflecting the strategic discipline Real Madrid maintained to see off the game.

Overall, Real Madrid’s 1-0 victory was a testament to their persistence and tactical acumen, managing to capitalize on a crucial numerical advantage in the later stages of the match. Their robust defense and ability to grind out the victory amid numerous stops and starts were commendable, maintaining their upper hand in this fiercely competitive derby. The rivalry was played out with characteristic intensity, and while it may not have been the most fluid or high-scoring game, it certainly did not lack drama and strategic depth.
